    "comment": """
    Grants: Foodbillion is building a software/app to create food waste reduction or food losses in the way that the software translates into returns of cash while concurrently, saving starving people globally.         and further helping to mitigate food losses. The technological application of Foodbillion will have sell or donate option of excess food or waste food. This is to enable households across the globe to sell their waste food or excess food to firms that will drive to their homes to pick the waste food or excess food to offer them payments. There 
        is also a platform where households or users can take pictures of their waste food or excess food and upload it online and auction it for firms or households who need the excess food or waste food to turn it into value to buy them. To promote increased access to healthy and sustainable foods, the Foodbillion software creates an online network where
        urban population around the world meet biannually to deliberate on ways of addressing and advocating for communities that are experiencing issues such as hunger, social injustice, economic inequality and political under-representation. Also, the online platform has a volunteering service that enable the urban population to travel to deprived regions to learn from problems and find solutions to them.
        For governments to promote increased access to healthy and sustainable foods, there is an online platform where townhall meetingwith urban population is made quarterly 
        to learn from their challenges and ways to address them. For  international organizations/NGOs, there is a platform where annual

```json
{
    "decision": "Yes",
    "comment": "Paper-based Cross Border Trade documents (BOls) in the food industry. Inefficient.

Solution consists of replacing BOls with blockchain-enabled Bills of Lading. It will be piloted in three countries.

Expected outcome of this is that there will be a 30% reduction in trade logistics cost and 30% increase in efficiency.

No new innovation or data will be generated by this project."
}
```<|im_end|>

Noticing that: -

In accordance with the grant's theme "Decarbonisation", this project aims to enhance visual communication and therefore reduce "miscommunication" scenarios, which is not related to the focus on visual science.

The solutions are not novel and the solutions (training program) and its target audience (urban dwellers) are expectedly established.

As the visual science field is related to the focus on creative visuals and 3D science, it can be related to the focus on visual science. 
If you need more detailed information on this specific submission please let us know.

- - -

Key points: related to visual science

Overall, the grant application looks promising as it focuses on the importance of visual communication and carbon footprint reduction. However, the solution presented seems to be non-novel.

It is worth considering whether this grant's focus can be more aligned with the field of visual science, which includes creative works using 3D science, as well as the challenges faced by Singapore in achieving carbon neutrality.

If you can identify a related challenge to the grant's theme, please let us know so we can better assess this application. If you have any more information on this submission, please let us know. We will provide an update on whether to accept it and make a decision.

Please refer to below link under "Further information required" if you can provide more data.
https://www.gov.jm/webforms/SavannaF2/UploadFile?moduleId=10&taskId=45&filename=50140214-1562_Decarbonize-v1-Grant-Application.docx<|im_end|>

```json
{
    "decision": "No",
    "comment": "Based on the solution, is a new and existing tech company. 
Collaborated with Unisense, IGS, a fintech company, and an ESG consultancy to develop scalable and robust data. They provide a cost-effective approach for companies. Also in B2B platform.

Sustainability data is a challenge across industries and companies face numerous data gaps and varying frameworks, leading to fragmented, inaccurate or incomplete data. Uncovering and analyzing these gaps will allow us to identify new ways to measure and improve sustainability performance."

Till now, the platform has been developed and tested with one provider, but future partners will include the B2B and ESG consultancy.

The data management platform was developed using Machine Learning and Data analytics and now aims to integrate with ESG and regulatory bodies.

To achieve this objective and meet investors' growing demand, there is a need for scalable and automated sustainability data management. We will help users bridge gaps across industries and frameworks, and deliver complete accuracy of ESG metrics. The platform is scalable, easy-to-use and helps provide a consistent standard across the industry."

Highlighting 9 Key Features of the solution, 390+ SMEs using Trivity with 46,000 users and 12+ million data inputs. The platform has achieved 95% data accuracy in its validation.

```json
{
    "decision": "Yes",
    "comment": "Monitoring infrastructure solution using satellite data, AI and cloud computing to assist the transparency and tracking of deforestation and carbon emission levels across the globe, with potential applications in biodiversity conservation. A lot of data has been generated on deforestation and conservation efforts but there are inconsistencies in reported levels.

The new model predicts deforestation rate and carbon sinks based on satellite data and the analysis of remote sensing data, which can then be used by organizations and policymakers to set more rigorous standards and improve policy effectiveness.

The project is a part of a broader initiative being conducted by the NERC (Natural Environment Research Council) funded in consortium by ESRC, DfE, DEFRA, Innovate UK, NERC, NCCN, EUN, DTAE, IWT and The Government Office for Science to tackle environmental problems such as CO2 and nitrous oxide in Europe. The consortium has identified the need for reliable, up-to-date and easily interpretable data to be used by policymakers, scientists, and the general public.

Blue Sky Analytics has developed a monitoring infrastructure called ESS (Environmental Sustainability System) with the support of ESRC and NERC. The data provides a set of key parameters that can help policymakers, organizations and researchers identify areas that need immediate action, and plan for action to address these issues.

The project will be managed by an advisory board consisting of 5 ESRC Research Fellows (representing the scientific community), 5 NERC Research Fellows (representing the civil society and policy sector), and 2 representatives from Innovate UK. The project will be delivered in collaboration with the University of Sheffield and the University of Bristol.

The project will focus on deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions from land-use change, but may expand to include other ESG challenges such as water usage, nutrient pollution, urban environmental and energy."}
}
```<|im_end|>
